meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dirty.
meanings.sent1: The dirtiness of the floor made it unpleasant to walk on.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the dirtiness of the old abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The dirtiness of the dog's paws left muddy prints all over the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The dirtiness of the river water was a stark reminder of pollution.
meanings.sent5: The dirtiness of the dishes in the sink was overwhelming.

meanings.definition: The presence of dirt or impurities.
meanings.sent1: The dirtiness on the window obscured the view outside.
meanings.sent2: The dirtiness of the air in the city was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The dirtiness of the water in the pond attracted curious ducks.
meanings.sent4: The dirtiness of the oil spill devastated the marine life.
meanings.sent5: The dirtiness of the clothes after playing outside was hard to miss.

meanings.definition: The act of making something dirty.
meanings.sent1: Her little brother's dirtiness always resulted in a messy room.
meanings.sent2: The dirtiness caused by the construction work was unavoidable.
meanings.sent3: The dirtiness of the paint splatters added a unique touch to the artwork.
meanings.sent4: The dirtiness of the mud tracked into the house led to extra cleaning.
meanings.sent5: The dirtiness of the spilled juice stained the tablecloth.
